intro: Ceraia limii, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Ceraia limii is known for its ability to bloom continuously under suitable conditions.
